main event: Two weather observers in Brest, France, observed a luminous triangular object in the sky on April 18, 1963.
interesting points: The object was first seen at an azimuth of 280 degrees and an elevation of 20 degrees.,The object moved slowly from west to east and hovered for about 5 minutes.,It maintained a constant altitude and disappeared to the east after a short period.,The object appeared to be triangular in shape and luminous with a reddish-orange color.,No sound was heard during the sighting.
witness description: weather observers at the Brest Meteorological Station
